Ghrelin is related to lower brain reward activation during touch
The “hunger” hormone ghrelin is associated with neural activation during touch, but not its affective experience

works.title: Climate-Protective Packaging: Using Basic Physics to Solve Climatic Challenges for Electronics in Demanding Applications
works.abstract: More and more electronics are being used in climatically harsh environments. Therefore, the challenge of designing climate-protective packaging continues to increase. Still, relatively little is known among design engineers about how to design for robustness and how to model and predict the lifetime of electronics in moist environments and, in part...

works.title: Climatic challenges and product level solutions for electronics in demanding applications
works.abstract: In the past, electronics was handled very carefully and used in controlled dry environments only. Still, relatively short lifetimes were accepted. Today long lifetime and high reliability is expected, despite increased climatic load including condensation. High temperatures and temperature cycling are very well known loads that limit life time, e.g...

works.title: Field failures of electronic systems
works.abstract:
Results of a research project recently concluded at the Danish
Engineering Academy are presented. The scope of the research was to
investigate the field-failure pattern of electronic systems of some
complexity. The project included a close survey of 10000 to 15000
electronic systems in use in Denmark. A physically-explainable model is
demonstrated...
